intro: Codonoboea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
